intro: Brachystegia sapinii, commonly known as the African brachystegia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Leguminosae (Fabaceae), characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters, with a broad, spreading canopy. Its bark is often fissured and varies in color from gray to reddish-brown. Brachystegia sapinii plays a vital role in its ecosystem by providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
